Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.CommandBuilder.arity(int)
    pass any Arguments to your Command to Command.Command(Argument...)
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.RepeatedArgumentBuilder.arity(int)
    this method should be called before ArgumentBuilder.repeated()
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.OptionArgumentBuilder.arity(int)
    an optional flag can only have an arity of zero
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.MapArgumentBuilder.arity(int)
    because ArgumentBuilder.MapArgumentBuilder.arity(int) should be called before ArgumentBuilder.asPropertyMap().
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.SplitterArgumentBuilder.arity(int)
    you can't use both ArgumentBuilder.splitWith(String) and ArgumentBuilder.SplitterArgumentBuilder.arity(int)
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.CommandBuilder.defaultValue(ParsedArguments)
    Commands shouldn't have default values
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.CommandBuilder.defaultValueDescriber(Describer)
    Commands can't have default values, so no description can be useful
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.CommandBuilder.defaultValueDescription(String)
    Commands can't have default values, so no description can be useful
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.CommandBuilder.defaultValueSupplier(Supplier)
    Commands shouldn't have default values
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.CommandBuilder.limitTo(Predicate)
    Commands can't be limited
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.MapArgumentBuilder.repeated()
    because ArgumentBuilder.MapArgumentBuilder.repeated() should be called before ArgumentBuilder.asPropertyMap()
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.CommandBuilder.required()
    Commands shouldn't be required
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.OptionArgumentBuilder.required()
    an optional flag can't be required
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.OptionArgumentBuilder.separator(String)
    a separator is useless since an optional flag can't be assigned a value
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.CommandBuilder.splitWith(String)
    Commands can't be split
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.ArityArgumentBuilder.splitWith(String) 
     This doesn't work with ArgumentBuilder.arity(int) or ArgumentBuilder.variableArity()
 I.e --foo 1,2 3,4
 is currently unsupported
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.RepeatedArgumentBuilder.splitWith(String)
    call ArgumentBuilder.RepeatedArgumentBuilder.splitWith(String) before ArgumentBuilder.repeated()
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.OptionArgumentBuilder.splitWith(String)
    an optional flag can't be split by anything
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.MapArgumentBuilder.splitWith(String)
    because ArgumentBuilder.MapArgumentBuilder.splitWith(String) should be called before ArgumentBuilder.asPropertyMap(). This is to make generic work its magic and produce the correct type, for example Map<String, List<Integer>>.
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.CommandBuilder.variableArity()
    pass any Arguments to your Command to Command.Command(Argument...)
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.RepeatedArgumentBuilder.variableArity()
    this method should be called before ArgumentBuilder.repeated()
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.OptionArgumentBuilder.variableArity()
    an optional flag can only have an arity of zero
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.MapArgumentBuilder.variableArity()
    because ArgumentBuilder.asPropertyMap() is already of variable arity
    se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.SplitterArgumentBuilder.variableArity()
    you can't use both ArgumentBuilder.splitWith(String) and ArgumentBuilder.SplitterArgumentBuilder.variableArity()
